intro: Senecio platyphyllus, commonly known as the broadleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage. Senecio platyphyllus is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
